title: The Lakes of Nainital
quote: Gentle lakes reflect quiet hills, where time slows and every moment feels peaceful and complete.

details.title: Arrival & a Calm Evening at Naini Lake

details.description: After a 9-hour train journey from Lucknow, we arrived in Kathgodam and rented a scooty there.
Reached Nainital after a long drive from Kathgodam. Checked into a Ashok Hotel.
Enjoyed a boat ride on Naini Lake. The water was so calm, it felt like time stood still.
Reaching Snow View Point via a gondola ride was wonderful.The calm and beautiful atmosphere was captivating, making it feel like time had completely stopped.

details.text: The cool breeze and the towering peaks... this isn't just a trip, it's the essence of life.

details.title: We explored Khurpatal, Lovers Point, Suicide Point, Cave Garden, trekked Naina Peak, and spent the night in Bhimtal.

details.description: We went to see Khurpatal, a quiet lake village surrounded by green trees. It's a peaceful place to relax and enjoy nature.

We went to see Lovers Point, known for its beautiful valley views, and then the dramatic Suicide Point, which offers breathtaking sights from its steep cliffs. Both spots are popular for their stunning natural grandeur.
We went to see Cave Garden, a unique place with several interconnected natural caves that you can explore. It's an interesting spot for a different kind of natural beauty.
Then, before we started our trek to Naina Peak, we ate some Maggie noodles, and then began our climb.
After trekking for two hours, we reached the top, but had to wait for an hour for the weather to clear. However, it didn't clear up, so we started our descent.
Then, we came back down, had some tea, and left for Bhimtal.

details.text: The mountains don’t just stand tall — they teach you how to rise, no matter how heavy the storm.

details.title: On Day 3, we saw the Bhalu Gaad waterfall in Mukteshwar, then we saw Naukuchiatal. After that, we left for Kathgodam station.

details.description: Going from Bhimtal to Mukteshwar, we enjoyed the truly beautiful views throughout the drive.
After driving our scooty for 2.5 hours, we reached Bhalu Gaad waterfall.
After enjoying our time at Bhalu Gaad Waterfall, we left for Naukuchiatal and, after a 2-hour drive, reached there and spent an hour.
Then we came back to Bhimtal and ate Maggie
And finally, after spending an hour at Bhimtal Lake, we left for Kathgodam station, enjoying a beautiful sunset view.

details.text: Beneath the endless sky and over the winding roads… I found peace in every breath of the journey.

title: The Calm Hills of Rajgir
quote: Among ancient hills and quiet paths, Rajgir whispers stories of peace and time.

details.title: A Midnight Arrival Through Silent Hills and Hidden Paths

details.description: Booked a current ticket and started the journey from Mughalsarai to Rajgir without any fixed plan.

Reached Rajgir station late at night to a town that was silent and cold. Walked through empty streets searching for a hotel but found none, so we waited quietly for morning, watching the night fade into dawn. Finally found a hotel early in the morning, checked in, and went straight to sleep.
Woke up fresh, had breakfast, and got ready to explore Rajgir.
Visited Shanti Stupa and reached the top by cable car. The ride was thrilling and the view felt unreal.
Returned back and headed towards Ghora Katora. While walking together, discovered a new lake that was incredibly beautiful and peaceful.
Started another trek nearby. The path was empty — only us, surrounded by hills and silence.
As evening approached, fear started to set in. The trek felt risky, so we decided to cancel it and return safely.
Came back to the room, rested, and let the tiredness settle in after a long adventurous day.

details.title: Wildlife, Missed Treks & A Delayed Goodbye

details.description: Woke up in the morning, checked out of the hotel while keeping all our luggage safely there, had breakfast nearby, and got ready for the final day of exploration.
Left for the Zoo Safari. Our entry ticket was scheduled for 12:00 PM, so we spent some time roaming around the area.
Entered the Zoo Safari. The ticket also included a wildlife show, which we watched and enjoyed together.
Returned for lunch after the safari and took a short break to relax.
Visited Brahm Kund. We planned to trek uphill, but unfortunately, entry was closed after 3 PM.
Instead, we went to the opposite hill and sat there for almost two hours, clicking photos and enjoying the quiet view.
After eating and drinking something nearby, we started walking back to the hotel on foot.
Collected our luggage from the hotel, had dinner, and left for Rajgir station, where we found out that the train was delayed.
After a two-hour wait, the train finally arrived. We boarded it and headed back to Mughalsarai, ending the journey.

details.text: Through sleepless nights, silent hills, and shared laughter, the journey became a memory written by three souls walking the same path.

title: Journey to the Valleys of Kashmir
quote: Through long waits and unexpected moments, every road to Kashmir begins with a story.

details.title: The Long Night at New Delhi Station Before the Journey to Kashmir

details.description: Reached New Delhi Railway Station with Abhishek and Iftakhar. Met Ashish there, and together we had dinner before waiting for our train.
Our train, Jhelum Express, was supposed to arrive at night, but it was delayed for many hours. We kept waiting at the station.
To pass the time, we bought a pack of playing cards and started playing at the station while waiting for the train.

While playing cards, CRPF officers caught us and warned that they could take us to the police station. We requested them many times, paid a fine, and they finally let us go. Before leaving, they also gave us some advice and safety tips.
After a very long wait, Jhelum Express finally arrived. We boarded the train, feeling tired from the night, and soon fell asleep as our journey toward Kashmir began.

details.title: Entering Jammu & Kashmir and the Mountain Road to Srinagar

details.description: Woke up in the train and had a simple breakfast of peanut butter, bread, and poha while enjoying the journey.
As soon as we entered Jammu & Kashmir, our phone networks stopped working after Kathua. Everyone lost signal, making the journey feel more isolated and adventurous.
We got down and had tea before continuing our journey toward Banihal.
On the way, we met some cab drivers. After talking for a while, we booked a cab to Srinagar for ₹3600 and started the road journey.
Stopped at a restaurant on the way and had dinner before continuing the drive through the mountains.
Reached Banihal at night. The temperature was around -9°C. We stopped for tea, feeling the intense cold of the mountains.
Continued the journey and finally reached Srinagar. Our driver, Sakib bhai, helped us find a hotel for ₹1500 per night. Exhausted from the long journey, we checked in and went straight to sleep.

details.text: The moment we entered Jammu & Kashmir, the air felt different — quieter, deeper — as if the mountains themselves were welcoming us into their world.

details.title: Snowy Adventures in Sonamarg and a Cozy Evening

details.description: Checked out of the hotel early with all our luggage and started the journey toward Sonamarg. Stopped on the way for breakfast before continuing.
For the first time, we saw snow-covered mountains up close. The view was breathtaking and made the journey even more exciting.
Reached Sonamarg and booked ponies for ₹1600 per person. It felt quite expensive, but we went ahead with it.
Visited different scenic points, played in the snow, made reels, ate Maggi, and truly enjoyed the snowy atmosphere.
Returned downhill on the ponies and then sat in the cab to head back.
Booked a new hotel on the way for ₹3000 per day, including breakfast and dinner. Stopped for tea before reaching.
Checked into the hotel, freshened up, and relaxed after the long day.
Lit hookah, had dinner, played cards, enjoyed the cozy evening together, and then went to sleep.

details.text: Sonamarg was where we first touched winter’s magic — where snow, silence, and wonder met our laughter for the very first time.

details.description: Went out for local sightseeing. First, we visited Shankaracharya Temple. Iftakhar bhai did something really stupid there that made all of us very angry. It completely spoiled the mood for a while.
From the temple, we went to Dal Lake. We explored the lake in a boat ride for ₹2000, drank kahwa, ate sweet corn, and enjoyed the peaceful beauty of the water. We also gave the boatman a ₹200 tip.
Next, we visited Pari Mahal and spent some time enjoying the views and relaxing there.
We planned to visit the zoo, but when we reached, it was closed. So we returned and stopped on the way to eat food around 4 PM.
Went back to the room, rested, played cards, transferred photos from our phones, and relaxed.
Had something to eat, smoked hookah, spent some quiet time together, and then went to sleep.

details.text: Srinagar moved like a dream — calm waters, slow moments, and memories floating gently like ripples on Dal Lake.

details.title: The Snowy Heights of Gulmarg and Gondola Adventure

details.description: Left for Gulmarg after breakfast.
Rented snow boots before continuing the journey.
Reached Gulmarg and stood in line for Gondola Phase 1 and Phase 2. After waiting about one hour, our turn came.
First went to Phase 2 at around 14,300 feet. Oxygen level was low but views were breathtaking. Spent about one hour taking photos and making reels.
Returned to Phase 1 and enjoyed playing in the snow for around two hours.
Stood in line again to return by gondola.
After reaching down, visited Gulmarg woolen factory for shopping. Friends bought shawls.
Returned to the hotel, enjoyed dinner, relaxed after an amazing day, and went to sleep.

details.text: Gulmarg was not just snow and height — it was standing above the clouds, feeling small before nature’s endless power.

details.title: Exploring Pahalgam and Preparing for the Journey Back

details.description: Left for Pahalgam in the morning. Stopped at a dry fruits shop on the way, drank kahwa, and bought some dry fruits.
Reached Apple Valley and drank fresh apple juice before continuing toward Pahalgam.
Reached Pahalgam where union taxi was mandatory. Booked an Omni for ₹1600 to visit two points.
Visited Betab Valley and spent about one hour enjoying the scenery.
Went to Aru Valley, had snacks, explored the area, and made reels.
Returned by union taxi, then headed back to hotel. Stopped for kahwa and took a photo with driver Sakib bhai.
Reached hotel. Sakib bhai stayed for a while, tried hookah, and arranged a cab for Jammu next day at ₹1000 per person.
Had dinner, shared photos with each other, packed bags for the journey, and went to sleep.

details.text: Pahalgam felt like a peaceful breath between mountains — where rivers whispered, valleys stretched wide, and time slowed down.

details.title: Return Journey to Delhi — The End of a Beautiful Trip

details.description: Checked out of the hotel and left for Jammu.
Reached Jammu. Our train was at 10 PM, so we spent time waiting at the station and walking around.
Boarded the train, had dinner, and everyone went to sleep after a long and memorable journey.
Reached Delhi by afternoon. Everyone said goodbye and went their own ways, carrying memories of an unforgettable Kashmir trip.

details.text: As we left Kashmir behind, we carried more than photos — we carried moments that would live quietly in our hearts forever.

From endless train waits to snowy peaks, from laughter to tired silences, Kashmir became more than a destination — it became a journey of friendship, adventure, and memories that will stay with us long after the mountains fade from sight.
